intro: Rhinanthus wagneri var. hercegovinus, commonly known as the Hercegovine yellowtop, is a flowering plant native to parts of the Balkans. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer, typically from July to August. It grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species in its native range.
